subsection.name: Prerequisites
subsection.p: These instructions assume that you have a Hippo project based on the Hippo project archetype, i.e. a Maven multiproject consisting of three submodules: cms, site and content/bootstrap.
You should know on how to use the HST jax-rs API
You should know how the OAI-PMH protocol works; offical website

subsection.name: Configure your content beans
subsection.p: There are 3 types of annotations you should use in your content beans:

ol.li: OAI: for setting the setName on the bean class
OAIDelegate: for delegating different metadata prefixes ("dc" etc)
OAIIdentifier: for generating the record identifier

subsection.name: Extending the org.onehippo.forge.oaipmh.provider.api.BaseOAIResource
subsection.p: Extend the org.onehippo.forge.oaipmh.provider.api.BaseOAIResource and implement the abstract methods accordingly as required by the oai protocol
* Note that you are responsible for you own resumption token parsing and usage
* Note that you are also responsible for handling the correct Jaxb context (for different namespaces; you might need to create your own jaxb context)

subsection.name: Add the resource to the Custom Jaxrs Plain resource Pipeline (or to custom pipeline)

li.source:
<bean id="jaxrsTestOAIPMHervice" class="org.onehippo.forge.oaipmh.provider.TestResource"/>
<!-- Custom JAX-RS REST Plain Resource Providers to be overriden.--> <bean id="customRestPlainResourceProviders" class="org.springframework.beans.factory.config.ListFactoryBean"> <property name="sourceList"> <list> <bean class="org.apache.cxf.jaxrs.lifecycle.SingletonResourceProvider"> <constructor-arg ref="jaxrsTestOAIPMHervice"/> </bean>
</list> </property> </bean>

li.p: Configure you hst mount configuration to display the correct mount on the URL. e.g. http://localhost:8080/site/jaxrs
